description: More than half of the Russian and Belarusian athletes cleared to compete at the Paris Olympics have links to military or national security agencies or shown support for the war in Ukraine, according to a human rights group.
title: Russian Athletes Headed to Paris Break IOC’s Own Rules and Sponsors Must Act, Says NGO

description: The new Labour government must “urgently” reverse rollbacks of green energy initiatives by its Conservative predecessor to meet the UK’s net-zero targets, a climate watchdog said.
title: UK Told to Reverse Sunak’s Green Rollback to Meet Net Zero Goal

description: Malaysia will decide in the coming months whether to proceed with a multibillion-dollar high-speed rail line between Kuala Lumpur and Singapore, as Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s government weighs proposals from a narrowing list of private consortiums.
title: Malaysia to Decide on Singapore High-Speed Rail Link This Year

description: President Joe Biden canceled his speech to a major Latino advocacy group in Las Vegas after testing positive for Covid-19, the White House announced Wednesday.
title: Biden Tests Positive for Covid-19, Scraps Las Vegas Event

description: President Xi Jinping will unveil his long-term vision for China’s economy as he wraps up a twice-a-decade conclave on reform, days after unexpectedly weak growth figures piled pressure on Beijing to act urgently to reinvigorate domestic demand.
title: Xi to Map Out Vision for China’s Economy as Key Meeting Wraps Up

description: Mexico’s congress could approve President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s proposed overhaul of the country’s judiciary before he leaves office at the end of September, according to a top senator who previously promised to proceed with caution on the reform.
title: Judicial Reform May Be Approved During AMLO’s Term, Senator Says

description: Keir Starmer spent the UK election campaign promising to reset Britain’s relationship with Europe after years of soured relations since Brexit. Just two weeks into his tenure, he’ll be able to immerse himself in that endeavor as he hosts over 40 of the continent’s leaders at Winston Churchill’s ancestral home on Thursday.
title: Starmer Starts UK Reset With Europe as Trump and Vance Loom

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, money and influence reporter Ted Mann looks at JD Vance taking the stage tonight at the Republican convention. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Vance Gets His Formal Introduction as Trump’s Running Mate

description: Jeff Yass gave $4 million to Greg Abbott’s campaign, adding to a $6 million check from December that the Texas governor’s office said was the largest single political donation in the state’s history.
title: Jeff Yass Gives $4 Million to Abbott After Record Texas Donation

description: Several major Russian commodity exporters say trade with China has become a gamble as direct payments made in yuan are increasingly being frozen or delayed after the US in June broadened the criteria for imposing sanctions.
title: Russian Firms Find It Increasingly Harder to Get Paid by China

description: US Special Counsel Jack Smith filed a notice of appeal with a federal court in Florida to challenge a judge’s decision earlier this week dismissing charges against Donald Trump over mishandling classified information and obstruction.
title: Special Counsel Is Appealing Dismissal of Trump Documents Case

description: Russia’s top diplomat signaled a preference for Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and especially his running mate JD Vance, praising their vocal interest in cutting a deal to end the war in Ukraine.
title: Russia’s Top Diplomat Praises Trump-Vance Ticket on Ukraine Stance

description: Donald Trump’s former national security adviser brushed aside concerns that 100% tariffs on some Chinese goods would fuel inflation and called for what he termed a broad “strategic decoupling” from Beijing, offering a taste of what economic and foreign policy might look like if the former president returns to power.
title: Ex-Trump Aide Says China Threat Is Clear But Taiwan Must Step Up

description: An anonymous whistleblower will receive more than $37 million for helping financial regulators investigate misconduct, according to the US Securities and Exchange Commission.
title: SEC Awards Whistleblower $37 Million for Aiding Investigation

description: President Joe Biden’s latest gambit to stabilize his reelection bid has been a veer to the left, looking to bolster progressive support by floating ambitious new proposals to erase medical debt, cap rent increases and impose sweeping new restraints on the Supreme Court.
title: Biden, Grasping to Stabilize Beleaguered Campaign, Lurches Left

description: San Francisco mayoral candidate Mark Farrell has a plan to get workers back into downtown offices — and it doesn’t include commuter benefits or coffee machines.
title: San Francisco Mayor Hopeful Wants Tax Cut to Spur Return to Work

description: The Biden administration is launching a new technical assistance program to boost investment in Latin America and the Caribbean, as regional officials meet in Washington for talks on efforts to spur development, create jobs and counter migration pressures.
title: US Plans New Fund to Speed Up Latin America Investment Projects

description: Attendees hold signs and cheer during the 2024 Republican National Convention at the Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee, Wisconsin on July 16. Photographer: Angela Weiss/AFP/Getty Images
title: Updates From Republican National Convention

description: California Representative Adam Schiff, the front-runner in the state’s US Senate race, called Wednesday for Joe Biden to quit the presidential contest, reviving Democratic infighting over the troubled reelection campaign.
title: Adam Schiff Calls on Biden to Drop Out, Reviving Rebellion

description: Kenya’s main opposition coalition said it won’t join any coalition with a grouping led by President William Ruto.
title: Kenya Opposition Group Rejects Coalition Plans With Ruto Party

description: Former US President Donald Trump during the Republican National Convention (RNC) at the Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, US, on Tuesday, July 16, 2024. Former President Donald Trump tapped JD Vance as his running mate, elevating to the Republican presidential ticket a venture capitalist-turned-senator whose embrace of populist politics garnered national attention and made him a rising star in the party. Photographer: Hannah Beier/Bloomberg
title: Drill More, Regulate Less: Trump Talks Vision for a Second Term

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s center-right minority government must be available to compromise on its 2025 budget proposals if it wants backing in parliament for the plan, Socialist opposition leader Pedro Nuno Santos said.
title: Portugal’s Opposition Leader Tells Prime Minister to ‘Negotiate Seriously’ on Budget

description: Canada is reviewing how many long-term visas it grants to foreign students, underscoring the government’s desire to slow immigration and population growth.
title: Canada’s Immigration Minister Has a Message for Foreign Students: You Can’t All Stay

description: Speaker after speaker at the Republican National Convention this week has laid the blame for high inflation with the Biden administration.
title: Trump Plans Risk Spurring US Inflation That GOP Is Pledging to End

description: On this week’s Voternomics, potential Trump National Security Adviser Elbridge Colby discusses the possible future of Ukraine and Taiwan.
title: How America Will Pivot and Ask Allies to Pay If Trump Wins

description: Keir Starmer’s government plans to change UK law to make it easier to align with product standards in the European Union, a significant shift in approach included in the King’s Speech setting out the legislative agenda.
title: Starmer Plans Law Change to Simplify UK Alignment With EU Rules

description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu asked lawmakers to allow a one-time windfall tax on banks, alongside a request to increase government spending by as much as 6.2 trillion naira ($3.8 billion).
title: Nigeria’s Tinubu Eyes Bank Windfall Tax to Fund Infrastructure

description: For some Democratic donors, the assassination attempt on Donald Trump hasn’t altered the calculus over President Joe Biden’s reelection bid.
title: Biden Donors Still Want Him Out, But It’s Tougher Than Ever

description: Democrats will not hold a virtual roll call to formally nominate President Joe Biden until at least August, after an outcry from some who believed the process was being rushed at his behest to head off calls for him to stand aside.
title: Democrats Will Not Formally Nominate Biden Before August

description: The African National Congress met to decide whether to terminate former South African President Jacob Zuma’s party membership, after he campaigned for a rival group in this year’s election.
title: Zuma Faces ANC Hearing Over His South African Election Rebellion

description: US investors weren’t expecting much turbulence from the 2024 presidential election. Voters were familiar with both repeat nominees, who seemed poised for a tight race till the end. But that changed quickly after the disastrous showing by President Joe Biden at the first presidential debate in June and then the assassination attempt against Donald Trump on July 13.
title: The ‘Trump Trade’ Is Back, Here’s What to Know

description: Venezuelan officials arrested the head of security for Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, less than two weeks before the presidential vote.
title: Venezuela Arrests Head of Security for Opposition Leader Machado

description: Russian ally Belarus has allowed visitors from 35 European countries visa-free access to its territory via land border crossings as the country’s president Alexander Lukashenko attempts to strike a friendlier tone in the face of growing tensions with western neighbors.
title: Belarus Expands Visa-Free Regime for Europeans Amid Tensions

description: Turkey’s foreign, defense and energy ministers visited Niger on Wednesday to secure access to the West African nation’s rich uranium deposits.
title: Turkey Top Envoy Goes to Niger in Bid to Secure Uranium Supplies

description: UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy is planning to channel extra foreign aid spending toward measures to encourage people to remain in their own countries rather than migrate to the UK, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: UK’s Lammy to Raise Foreign Aid Spending to Counter Migration

description: A former Wall Street Journal reporter in Hong Kong said she was fired for taking up a position as the head of a local journalist group that advocates for press freedom.
title: Hong Kong Reporter Says WSJ Fired Her for Press Freedom Advocacy

description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged a total of 190 prisoners in a swap mediated by the United Arab Emirates, the sixth such transfer this year.
title: Russia and Ukraine Exchange 190 Prisoners in UAE-Brokered Deal

description: When Teamsters chief Sean O’Brien called Donald Trump “one tough S.O.B.” on Monday night, the former president beamed and his supporters cheered.
title: Trump’s Teamster Flirtation Complicates Republican Labor Stance

description: The World Trade Organization highlighted China’s “lack of transparency” on industrial subsidies, suggesting the absence of such public information is fueling complaints from other nations about the threat of Chinese goods flooding the global economy.
title: WTO Cites ‘Lack of Transparency’ on China’s Industrial Subsidies

description: The Labour Party will press ahead with its plans to add a 20% value-added tax on fees for the UK’s elite private schools, King Charles III confirmed Wednesday in his King’s Speech.
title: Labour to Press Ahead With Tax Hike on UK Private-School Fees

description: The new UK government plans to bring in sweeping new changes that would extend equal pay rights to ethnic minority and disabled workers.
title: UK Plans to Introduce Ethnicity Pay Gap Reporting for Companies

description: King Charles III on Tuesday delivered a speech outlining the legislative agenda planned for the new Parliamentary session by the UK’s first Labour government in 14 years. Prime Minister Keir Starmer is proposing 40 bills, draft bills and repeals — almost double the agenda detailed in the last King’s Speech by the outgoing Conservative government. Below is a summary of the plans:
title: What’s in the King’s Speech From Buses to Planning and Cyber

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer vowed to pursue Britain’s most ambitious planning reforms in decades and insisted getting the country building was a non-negotiable part of boosting economic growth, as he unveiled a wide-ranging legislative program for his landslide-winning Labour government.
title: Starmer Rips Up Planning Rules to Boost Growth in King’s Speech

description: The UK government will impose new rules on water companies in England and Wales in a bid to curb sewage spills into rivers and seas.
title: UK Government Plans Tougher Sewage Rules for Water Companies

description: Ghana’s Supreme Court deferred a ruling on a request by two citizens to prevent a draconian anti-LGBTQ bill from being signed into law.
title: Ghanaian Court Defers Ruling on Proposed Anti-LGBTQ Legislation

description: Two near-identical oil tankers trying to beat western sanctions. A secret transfer of Russian crude halfway between Iran and Oman. A supertanker giving a false location.
title: Russian Games Make Secret Tanker Oil Switching Harder to Trace

description: The eldest son of late former Italian Premier Silvio Berlusconi was tempted to follow in his father’s political footsteps but for now he says he’s committed to his family’s broadcasting business.
title: Berlusconi Heir Says Business Wins Over Politics in His Future

description: Elon Musk is going all in on right-wing politics.
title: Elon Musk’s ‘Final Straw’ Moment Marks Political Transformation

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Emboldened Trump Puts Taiwan and Europe on Edge

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s cabinet approved a draft budget for next year, backing the contentious finance plan that was sealed this month after weeks of squabbling over limited funds.
title: Scholz’s Cabinet Approves Contentious Federal Budget for 2025

description: Angola plans to remain an investor in Portuguese lender Banco Comercial Portugues SA and oil company Galp Energia SGPS SA, while it sells other assets to bolster its finances.
title: Angola Is ‘Very Happy’ With Holdings in Portuguese Firms Galp and BCP, Minister Says

description: Two months ago, Wiz Inc. was basking in a major milestone: It had just raised a $1 billion funding round, boosting its valuation to $12 billion. Investors were excited about the cloud security startup, which was absorbing $400 million in acquisitions, rapidly expanding its US footprint and starting to eye an initial public offering.
title: A Cyber Startup’s Pandemic Luck May Lead to $23 Billion Payday

description: Negotiations aimed at winding down Israel’s nine-month war on Hamas in Gaza face four key sticking points, including which hostages should be released, according to people with knowledge of the talks.
title: Israel-Hamas Truce Talks Said to Face Four Key Sticking Points

description: Presidential candidate Donald Trump’s pick for running mate is JD Vance, a memoirist turned senator who has been very critical of China across a range of issues.
title: ‘I Don’t Like China:’ What JD Vance Has Said About Beijing

description: DHAKA, Bangladesh (AP) — Authorities in Bangladesh urged all universities to close on Wednesday, the day after at least six people died in violent protests over the allocation of government jobs and police raided the headquarters of the main opposition party.
title: Bangladesh Urges Universities to Close After 6 Die in Protests Over Government Jobs

description: India has nominated retired diplomat Vinay Kwatra as its next ambassador to the US, months before the country heads to a pivotal election, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: India Nominates Retired Diplomat as US Ambassador to Secure Ties

description: Thailand’s top constitutional judges will rule on Aug. 7 on whether to disband the nation’s largest opposition party that has been accused of breaking election rules over its campaign to amend a stringent royal defamation law.
title: Thai Court to Rule Aug. 7 Whether to Disband Opposition Party

description: The death of a Malaysian TikTok user has prompted the government to look into criminalizing cyberbullying and increasing accountability among internet service providers.
title: TikTok User’s Death Sparks Malaysia Clampdown on Cyberbullying

description: Thai lawmakers have started discussing Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s request for an additional 122 billion baht ($3.4 billion) budget on Wednesday to help fund the government’s flagship stimulus plan.
title: Thai Lawmakers to Weigh Extra $3.4 Billion Budget for Cash Gift

description: Taiwan’s premier touted his island’s moves to better defend itself, after Donald Trump declared the chip hub “should pay” for US protection against Chinese military aggression.
title: Taiwan Defends Actions After Trump Demands It Pay for Defense

description: The Biden administration, facing pushback to its chip crackdown on China, has told allies that it’s considering using the most severe trade restrictions available if companies such as Tokyo Electron Ltd. and ASML Holding NV continue giving the country access to advanced semiconductor technology.
title: US Floats Idea of Tougher Trade Rules in Chip Crackdown on China

description: A prominent minister running Japan’s digital agency left the door open for a bid to become prime minister as he called on the central bank to increase interest rates to boost the value of the yen and bring down energy and food costs.
title: Japan’s Kono Says Central Bank Needs to Raise Rates to Lift Yen

description: The US Federal Bureau of Investigation has joined Thai authorities in probing the mysterious deaths of six foreigners at a luxury hotel in Bangkok on Tuesday, according to Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin.
title: FBI Joins Probe Into Foreigner Deaths at Bangkok Luxury Hotel

description: Donald Trump’s one-time rivals in the race for president lined up behind him at the Republican National Convention, calling for unity in the wake of an assassination attempt but lambasting Democrats as a party of destruction that is allowing illegal immigrants to overwhelm the country.
title: Trump’s Former Rivals Unite Behind Him at Republican Convention

description: US prosecutors indicted a former Central Intelligence Agency analyst specializing in North Korea on charges of working as an agent for South Korea after leaving the agency in exchange for luxury goods and other gifts.
title: Ex-CIA Official Accused of Helping South Korea for Luxury Bags
